qas.question: Captain America, Thor and Ultron all inhabit what fictional milieu?
Fictional placements within this setting are modeled off what?
Spiderman's fictional city is based off what real American location?
What Marvel character's stories are set in an area resembling the American Southwest?
Which two groups of Marvel crimefighters are based in a fictional version of New York City?
Where is the character of Ant-Man based?

What were many real-life locations based off of?
Which group fought the Fantastic Four in New York City?

context: Marvel counts among its characters such well-known superheroes as Spider-Man, Iron Man, Captain America, Wolverine, Thor, Hulk, Ant-Man, such teams as the Avengers, the Guardians of the Galaxy, the Fantastic Four, the Inhumans and the X-Men, and antagonists such as Doctor Doom, The Enchantress, Green Goblin, Ultron, Doctor Octopus, Thanos, Magneto and Loki. Most of Marvel's fictional characters operate in a single reality known as <b8_0>the <a0_0>Marvel Universe<b8_0/><a0_0/>, with locations that mirror <a1_0>real-life cities<a1_0/>. Characters such as Spider-Man, <a4_0>the Fantastic Four, <b9_0>the Avengers<b9_0/><a4_0/>, Daredevil and Doctor Strange are based in <b5_0>New York City<b5_0/>, whereas the X-Men have historically been based in <b6_0>Salem Center, <a2_0>New York<b6_0/><a2_0/> and <a3_0><b7_0>Hulk<a3_0/>'s<b7_0/> stories often have been set in the American Southwest.
